article.headline: Saint Louis 67, St. Bonaventure 65
article.story: ST. LOUIS -- Kwamain Mitchell hit a short jumper with 1.4 seconds left to lift Saint Louis past St. Bonaventure 67-65 in an Atlantic 10 Conference game on Wednesday night. Mitchell scored 16 of his game-high 17 points in the second half. Willie Reed added 11 points and 11 rebounds for Saint Louis (13-8, 4-3). Jonathan Hall and Andrew Nicholson scored 13 points for St. Bonaventure (9-11, 2-5), which has lost six of its last eight games. Saint Louis led 60-49 with 4:35 left before the Bonnies came back. Hall capped the rally by hitting a 3-pointer with 26 seconds left to tie it 65-65. Jon Smith added 11 points for Saint Louis, which broke a two-game losing streak.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
